Class Tab

The Tab component is a child of the Tabs component. It represents one Tab item and its content within a panel of other Tab items.

Tab takes a string or TemplateRef for the header, and any content for the body of the tab. Disabled states should be handled by the application (ie. switch to the tab, but display some indication as to why the tab is disabled).

When the tab is selected the select output will be triggered. The select output will also be triggered for the active tab when the tabs are loaded or updated.

Tab with string header:

<ibm-tab heading='tab1'>
    tab 1 content
</ibm-tab>

Tab with custom header:

<ng-template #tabHeading>
    <svg ibmIcon="facebook"
        size="sm"
        style="margin-right: 7px;">
    </svg>
    Hello Tab 1
</ng-template>
<ibm-tabs>
    <ibm-tab [heading]="tabHeading">
        Tab 1 content <svg ibmIcon="alert" size="lg"></svg>
    </ibm-tab>
    <ibm-tab heading='Tab2'>
        Tab 2 content
    </ibm-tab>
    <ibm-tab heading='Tab3'>
        Tab 3 content
    </ibm-tab>
</ibm-tabs>

active

@Input()
active: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/tabs/tab.component.ts:100

Indicates whether the Tab is active/selected. Determines whether it's TabPanel is rendered.

Used to set the id property on the element.

Allows the user to pass data to the custom template for the Tab heading.

disabled: boolean = false

Indicates whether or not the Tab item is disabled.

heading

@Input()
heading: string | TemplateRef<any>
  • Defined in src/tabs/tab.component.ts:84

The Tab's title to be displayed or custom temaplate for the Tab heading.

headingIsTemplate

headingIsTemplate: boolean = false
  • Defined in src/tabs/tab.component.ts:79

Boolean value reflects if the Tab is using a custom template for the heading. Default value is false.

id

@Input()
id: string = `n-tab-${nextId++}`
  • Defined in src/tabs/tab.component.ts:111

Sets the id of the Tab. Will be uniquely generated if not provided.

selected

@Output()
selected: EventEmitter<void> = new EventEmitter<void>()
  • Defined in src/tabs/tab.component.ts:121

Value 'selected' to be emitted after a new Tab is selected.

tabIndex

@Input()
tabIndex: number = 0
  • Defined in src/tabs/tab.component.ts:106

title

@Input()
title: string
  • Defined in src/tabs/tab.component.ts:91

Optional override for the tabItem's's title attribute which is set in TabHeaders. tabItem's title attribute is automatically set to heading.

You might want to use this if you set heading to a TemplateRef.
